ygData.subject: Re: The thrill of being a bard: was sonorous clounding message
ygData.msgSnippet: I am going to haul this thred out of the Lore item muck, and dust it off and set it back on the right track.... I amazed my group when we were able to camp mr.
ygData.messageBody:
I am going to haul this thred out of the Lore item muck, and dust it off and
set it back on the right track....

I amazed my group when we were able to camp mr. Webclaw in Lake rathe,
completely underwater with Tarew's blasting :). We managed to get 7 water
crystal staffs, and I plan to use mine for 1h blunt practice until a staff
of writhing comes my way :). its not a very good weapon though....

Gleeman Merrilin, bard of the 20th chorus
-----Original Message-----
From: Andy Simpson <gohorns@...>
To: eqbards@onelist.com <eqbards@onelist.com>
Date: Tuesday, August 31, 1999 11:14 PM
Subject: RE: [eqbards] The thrill of being a bard: was sonorous clounding
message


>From: "Andy Simpson" <gohorns@...>
>
>> Not sure what the underlying story is on when items
>> disappear and when they stay, but it'd be REAL nice
>> for us to know.
>
>For those wondering, this bug happens (lore items disappear when dropped)
>when they are in a bag. So long as you do transfers of all lore items
>outside of bags, even if you accidentally drop it, the item should be there
>laying on the ground where you dropped it. If its in a bag when its
>dropped, however, POOF!
>
>Anthem Dirgemaker
>Level 31 Half Elf Bard of Qeynos
>
>
